top_categories.workout_context: 530 miles. Your legs will beg to quit after 120. This trains the power output you need from mile 130 onward.
72,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 530 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
Colorado Trail Race's technical singletrack hiking trail — extensive forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 530 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Colorado Trail Race's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before August.
530 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Colorado Trail Race, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
At Colorado Trail Race, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
72,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
137ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on technical singletrack hiking trail — extensive. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 72,500ft of climbing on technical singletrack hiking trail — extensive does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.heat: August in Durango to Denver, Colorado. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Colorado Trail Race — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 530 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 530 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.altitude: Colorado Trail Race with 72,500ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Colorado Trail Race demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride technical singletrack hiking trail — extensive hike-a-bike both uphill and downhill at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 530 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, VO2max, and Endurance to prepare you for 530 miles of technical singletrack hiking trail — extensive hike-a-bike both uphill and downhill in Durango to Denver, Colorado.
